title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4212.12 - Assistance for commercial revitalization projects
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4212.12 - Assistance for commercial revitalization projects

State Regulations
(a) Maximum level of assistance from the
corporation: (1)
up to 100 percent of the
project architect's fee, but not to exceed an average of $1,200 per storefront
plus reimbursables which reimbursables shall not exceed 10 percent of the
project architect's fee; (2)
up to
50 percent of the eligible project costs for each participating storefront to a
maximum corporation investment of $7,500 per storefront, assuming an average
storefront measures 20 feet in width in a building not exceeding three stories; and
(3)
fifty percent of the total
eligible project costs, plus the costs of the public improvements and private
investments for the commercial revitalization project up to a maximum
corporation investment of up to $225,000. (b) Minimum level of assistance from the
corporation: (1)
minimum participation by the
corporation in any commercial revitalization project shall be $50,000; and
(2)
minimum per storefront
shall be $1,000. (c) Project architect. The project architect, who must be licensed to practice
architecture within the State (the "project architect"), shall be selected by
the corporation in consultation with the eligible recipient (or its designee)
based upon consideration of the following criteria: (1)
the proximity of the project architect's
offices to the location of the commercial revitalization project; (2)
the proposed fee for architectural
services; (3)
the proposed scope of
basic architectural services; and
(4)
prior experience of the project
architect. The project architect will work with the applicant and the
eligible recipient, property owners and tenants and the corporation to prepare
an overall design concept and specifications, and schematic drawings. The
project architect shall also prepare cost estimates and all necessary working
drawings and specifications for the eligible building facade improvements. The
project architect shall be responsible for contract administration during the
construction phase of the commercial revitalization project. The project
architect's services shall be performed pursuant to a contract with the
corporation. (d) Contractors. Participating property owners and/or tenants will be responsible
for hiring contractors to perform the eligible building facade improvements. Applicants are required to describe in their applications the assistance that
they will provide to property owners in meeting this requirement. Contractors
who own 51 percent or more of a contracting business and who wish to be
participating property owners and/or tenants will not be eligible to be hired
as the contractor to perform the eligible building facade improvements for
their own properties. Such contractors will, however, be eligible to perform
such improvements for other properties that participate in the commercial
revitalization project. All contractors must carry reasonable insurance. Contractors may also be required to be bonded in circumstances where they
receive partial payment from the corporation pending completion of
work. Notes
